Question: Unhappy with this, the peasantry appealed to this person at his ashram in Ahmedabad.
Hints: This person's family wanted him to be a barrister, as it would increase the prospects of succeeding to his father's post.
This person worked hard to win public support for the agitation across the country.
In December 1921, this person was invested with executive authority on behalf of the Indian National Congress.
